title: Tash Sultana reveals she's retiring from her solo music career
text:
Australian musician Tash Sultana has revealed she's retiring from her solo music career.

On Wednesday, the singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist made the announcement with a video posted to Instagram.

The clip showed the 24-year-old musician playing a mellow guitar riff with a caption that hinted at a potential collaborative career in the future.

'My final shows are coming up': Aussie musician Tash Sultana (pictured) revealed she's retiring from her solo music career with a mellow guitar riff on Wednesday

'I am wrapping up my career as a solo performer in the next coming months,' Tash wrote in the caption.

'My final Australian and New Zealand shows are coming up and are on sale now, one Melbourne show left to go and then I’ll be closing this wonderful chapter.

'We’ve spent the last two years designing our own custom loop station and for the first time I can finally use it back on home soil. I cannot waaaait.'

All over? 'I am wrapping up my career as a solo performer in the next coming months,' Tash wrote in the caption

He's a fan! American rapper Ty Dolla $ign flooded the comment section with goat emojis

The meaning: Ty's goat emojis suggested Tash was the 'GOAT', which stands for 'greatest of all time'. Pictured: Ty Dolla $ign

American rapper Ty Dolla $ign flooded the comment section with goat emojis, suggesting Tash was the 'GOAT', which stands for 'greatest of all time'.

Currently, Tash's last scheduled show is at Falls Festival in Byron Bay on New Year's Eve, although her caption hinted at a final show in her hometown of Melbourne.

The musician's solo retirement may come as a shock to fans as she only just released her first studio album, Flow State, in August last year.

The last leg: Tash's last scheduled show is at Falls Festival in Byron Bay on New Year's Eve, although her caption hinted at a final show in her hometown of Melbourne

However, the fact that Tash specifically mentioned her 'solo' career and said 'we’ve designed a custom loop station' suggests she will continue to make music, albeit in a more collaborative manner.

Tash is a self-taught musician who has been playing the guitar since she was three-years-old and began her career through busking and posting music online.

She rose to fame in 2016 when her single Jungle was voted third place in the Triple J Hottest 100, followed by a world tour the next year.
description: Australian musician Tash Sultana has revealed she's retiring from her solo music career.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
